choices.text:
Write a python function to calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers
Sure, here is one way you can do that.  The code below will take in an iterable (a sequence or collection) containing integers as input arguments called nums which represents your set of values for calculation purposes; it then calculates both mean() - the average value and stddev(nums)- standard deviation from those numbers, returning them back to you:
def calc_stats([int]): 
    mean = sum(n/len(list)  for n in list ) / len ( nums)) # calculate avg of all values divided by number or items 
stdDev= [sum((x- mean)**2 for x in numbers)/ float ((float)(nums).count() - 1)]#calculate standard deviation from the square difference between each value and average
